result.execSummary:
The defendant Deonis Allantae Grace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges, including DNA.  To be paid by 7/23/2015. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court advised defendant  that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; further advised that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deonis Allantae Grace

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 37 DAYS at the House of Corrections with 37 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA);  by 07/23/2015.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court ordered defendant's operating privileges revoked for 6 MONTHS with the mandatory reinstatement fee.  

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement

Defendant Deonis Allantae Grace in court with attorney Michael Jude for Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Karen A. Loebel for Zachary Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

At the parties request, case is calendared on the speedy dispo calendar for a plea and sentencing hearing on 04/24/2015 at 01:30 p.m., in Room 635 of the Courthouse, Judge Donald presiding.

04/17/2015

Defendant Deonis Allantae Grace in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Zachary Wittchow.
Case set for scheduling conference.  Defendant would like to resolve case.  Defense counsel to take case to early disposition court.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/10/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court address violation report.  Court order defendant to comply with conditions of Justice Point.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Pretrial and violation Report received and filed.  aw

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Deonis Allantae Grace not in court, in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel would like to file a motion.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 4/21/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deonis Allantae Grace in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Deonis Allantae Grace in custody.  Dennis Murphy for Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Matthew VanDrisse-MPD Officer. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF2139 that are attached to the complaint.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 03.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deonis Allantae Grace in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Deonis Allantae Grace in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
